intro: Barleria sepalosa, commonly known as the purple barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Barleria sepalosa thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
